name: ProjectMnemosyne
description: Skills marketplace for the HomericIntelligence agentic ecosystem

plugins.name: doc-generate-adr
plugins.description: Generate Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) to document significant architectural decisions. Use when: (1) Making significant architectural decisions, (2) Choosing between technical alternatives, (3) Documenting design trade-offs.

plugins.name: doc-validate-markdown
plugins.description: Validate markdown files for formatting, links, and style compliance using markdownlint. Use when: (1) Before committing documentation, (2) Markdown linting errors in CI, (3) Creating new documentation.

plugins.name: implementation-alignment-validation
plugins.description: Use when validating that implementation code matches research documentation, design specs, or theoretical frameworks. Triggers: 'validate implementation', 'check alignment', 'docs vs code', 'implementation matches theory', 'verify against research'.

plugins.name: implementation-theory-alignment
plugins.description: Use when validating implementation code against research documentation, design specs, or theory papers. Triggers: 'validate implementation', 'align with docs', 'check against research', 'implementation matches theory'. Provides systematic workflow for identifying discrepancies and implementing fixes.

plugins.name: quality-complexity-check
plugins.description: Analyze code complexity metrics including cyclomatic complexity and nesting depth. Use when: (1) Code review process, (2) Identifying refactoring candidates, (3) Maintaining code quality standards.

plugins.name: quality-security-scan
plugins.description: Scan code for security vulnerabilities and unsafe patterns. Use when: (1) Before committing code with secrets, (2) Security review process, (3) Pre-release security audit.

plugins.name: batch-pr-ci-fix
plugins.description: Batch fix CI failures across multiple PRs and enable auto-merge. Use when: (1) Multiple PRs have CI failures, (2) Need to fix common failure patterns, (3) Want to auto-merge PRs after CI passes. Handles broken links, formatting issues, mypy errors.

plugins.name: build-run-local
plugins.description: Run local builds with proper environment setup matching CI pipeline. Use when: (1) Building code locally before pushing, (2) Verifying changes work before creating PR, (3) Debugging build issues in isolation.

plugins.name: ci-failure-workflow
plugins.description: Complete CI failure debugging workflow. Contains 2 sub-skills: (1) analyze - parse CI logs to identify root causes and error patterns, (2) fix - systematic workflow to reproduce, fix, and verify CI issues. Use when CI checks fail on PR.

plugins.name: fix-docker-image-case
plugins.description: Fix Docker SBOM and workflow failures caused by mixed-case image names in GitHub Actions. Use when: SBOM generation fails with 'could not parse reference' errors, Docker workflows fail with case-related parsing issues.

plugins.name: fix-docker-platform
plugins.description: Fix Docker build failures caused by platform mismatches. Use when: (1) Docker builds fail with 'unsupported platform' errors, (2) pixi install fails in Docker with linux-aarch64 errors, (3) Multi-arch builds fail when pixi.toml only supports one platform.

plugins.name: fix-docker-shell-tty
plugins.description: Fix Docker interactive shell failures caused by missing TTY flags. Use when: (1) docker compose exec or docker exec fails for interactive shells, (2) justfile shell recipe doesn't work, (3) Terminal input/output not working in containerized shells. Root cause: -T flag disables TTY when -it flags are needed.

plugins.name: gh-check-ci-status
plugins.description: Check CI/CD status of a pull request including workflow runs and test results. Use when: (1) Verifying PR checks are passing before merge, (2) Investigating CI failures, (3) Monitoring long-running CI jobs.

plugins.name: github-actions-mojo
plugins.description: GitHub Actions CI setup for Mojo projects. Use when: (1) Setting up Mojo CI/CD, (2) Configuring pixi with GitHub Actions, (3) Running mojo test in CI. Verified with Mojo v0.25.7.

plugins.name: run-precommit
plugins.description: Run pre-commit hooks locally to validate code quality before committing. Use when: (1) Before committing code, (2) Testing if CI will pass, (3) After making code changes.

plugins.name: validate-workflow
plugins.description: Validate GitHub Actions workflow files for syntax and correctness. Use when: (1) Creating or modifying workflows, (2) Workflow syntax errors occur, (3) Before committing workflow changes.

plugins.name: verify-pr-ready
plugins.description: Verify PR is ready for merge with all requirements met. Use when: (1) Before merging a PR manually, (2) Validating PR readiness in batch operations, (3) Checking branch protection rule compliance.

plugins.name: fix-implicitlycopyable-removal
plugins.description: Systematic approach to removing ImplicitlyCopyable trait from Mojo structs and fixing resulting compilation errors. Use when: removing ImplicitlyCopyable from structs with List/Dict/String fields, fixing 'cannot implicitly copy' errors, debugging memory corruption from bitwise copies.

plugins.name: fix-randn-seed-bug
plugins.description: Fix unused seed parameter in random number generation functions. Use when: (1) Tests using seeded random inputs produce non-reproducible results, (2) randn/random functions declare seed parameter but generate different values each call, (3) assert_almost_equal fails with wildly different values for same-seeded inputs.

plugins.name: fixme-todo-cleanup
plugins.description: Systematic FIXME/TODO cleanup workflow with proper branching, PRs, and CI handling

plugins.name: judge-system-extension
plugins.description: Patterns for extending AI evaluation/judge systems with consensus retry, cleanup evaluation, cross-tier analysis, and container orchestration. Use when: (1) Adding new evaluation capabilities to a judge system, (2) Implementing consensus-based scoring with disagreement handling, (3) Creating container-based isolation for evaluators, (4) Adding cross-tier statistical analysis.

plugins.name: plan-review-interview
plugins.description: Structured interview workflow for reviewing implementation plans. Use when: (1) You have a draft plan that needs stakeholder validation, (2) GitHub issues exist but lack key decision details, (3) You need to systematically identify gaps before implementation, (4) You want to document decisions alongside affected issues.

plugins.name: create-review-checklist
plugins.description: Generate customized review checklists based on type of change. Use when: (1) Starting PR review for unfamiliar change type, (2) Need specific checklist for code vs tests vs docs, (3) Large multi-type changes needing organized review.

plugins.name: extract-test-failures
plugins.description: Extract and summarize test failures from logs. Use when: (1) CI test run failed, need to understand failures, (2) Large test suite with many failures needs summary, (3) Categorizing failures by type (assertion, runtime, timeout).

plugins.name: fix-placeholder-code-ci
plugins.description: Fix CI failures caused by partially commented placeholder code and dtype migration assertion mismatches

plugins.name: generate-fix-suggestions
plugins.description: Generate fix suggestions based on error patterns and best practices. Use when: (1) Test failures need concrete solutions, (2) Build errors require remediation steps, (3) Creating PR comments with suggestions.

plugins.name: test-diff-analyzer
plugins.description: Analyze test differences between runs to identify flaky tests. Use when: (1) Test passes locally but fails in CI, (2) Test sometimes passes, sometimes fails, (3) Need to understand test consistency issues.

plugins.name: ai-blog-generator
plugins.description: Generate AI-authored blog posts from git commit history. Use when: (1) Filling gaps in project blog history, (2) Need to document past work retroactively, (3) Creating development blog posts based on actual commits, (4) Backfilling documentation for dates without posts.

plugins.name: claude-plugin-format
plugins.description: Official Claude Code plugin format requirements. Use when: (1) Creating a new plugin, (2) Debugging plugin validation errors, (3) Skills or commands not appearing after install.

plugins.name: claude-plugin-marketplace
plugins.description: Set up Claude Code plugin marketplaces. Use when: (1) Registering a skills marketplace, (2) Fixing plugin.json schema errors, (3) Understanding marketplace.json format, (4) Installing plugins from private repos.

plugins.name: gh-batch-merge-by-labels
plugins.description: Batch merge multiple PRs by label matching. Use when: (1) Multiple PRs ready for merge with same status label, (2) End-of-sprint or release batch merges, (3) Automating merge of dependent chain of PRs.

plugins.name: gh-create-pr-linked
plugins.description: Create PRs properly linked to GitHub issues. Use when: (1) Creating a PR that implements a specific issue, (2) Need automatic issue linking in PR, (3) Ready to submit changes for review after completing work.

plugins.name: gh-post-issue-update
plugins.description: Post structured updates to GitHub issues for progress tracking. Use when: (1) Reporting implementation progress, (2) Documenting design decisions, (3) Posting completion summaries or findings.

plugins.name: gh-pr-review-workflow
plugins.description: Complete PR review feedback workflow. Contains 3 sub-skills: (1) get-comments - fetch all review comments from PR, (2) reply-comment - reply to individual review comments, (3) fix-feedback - full workflow to address and reply to all feedback. Use when addressing PR review comments.

plugins.name: gh-read-issue-context
plugins.description: Read context from GitHub issue including body and comments. Use when: (1) Before starting implementation work, (2) When prior context is needed, (3) Resuming work after a break and need to understand decisions made earlier.

plugins.name: git-worktree-workflow
plugins.description: Complete git worktree workflow for parallel development. Contains 4 sub-skills: (1) create - create isolated worktrees for new issues, (2) switch - navigate between worktrees, (3) sync - keep worktrees up-to-date with main, (4) cleanup - remove worktrees after PR merge. Use when working on multiple issues in parallel without stashing.

plugins.name: retrospective-hook-integration
plugins.description: Setup SessionEnd hooks for automatic retrospective prompts in Claude Code. TRIGGER: (1) When integrating ProjectMnemosyne marketplace with another repository, (2) When setting up /advise and /retrospective skills, (3) When configuring automatic session-end knowledge capture. Verified on Claude Code with ProjectOdyssey integration.

plugins.name: skill-audit-and-merge
plugins.description: Systematic audit and consolidation of skills marketplace plugins. Use when: (1) Marketplace has grown with overlapping plugins, (2) Need to identify merge candidates, (3) Improving plugin discoverability via tags, (4) Reorganizing categories for better structure.

plugins.name: skills-registry-commands
plugins.description: Complete skills registry system with 4 components: (1) /advise command - search skills before starting work, (2) /retrospective command - capture session learnings as new skills, (3) documentation-patterns skill - how to write effective skill docs, (4) validation-workflow skill - CI/CD for plugin validation. Use when setting up team knowledge capture or implementing the Sionic AI skills pattern.

plugins.name: technical-debt-tracker
plugins.description: Track and resolve FIXME/TODO comments by creating GitHub issues and updating stale references. Use when: (1) Auditing codebase for technical debt, (2) Creating structured issues for each debt category, (3) Updating stale issue references in comments.

plugins.name: verify-issue-before-work
plugins.description: Verify GitHub issue state and existing implementation before starting work to avoid duplicate effort. Use when: starting work on issues, resuming after breaks, taking over from other sessions.

plugins.name: grpo-external-vllm
plugins.description: GRPO training with external vLLM server. Use when: (1) Running vLLM on separate GPUs, (2) Encountering vllm_skip_weight_sync errors, (3) OpenAI API parsing issues. Verified on gemma-3-12b-it.

plugins.name: spec-driven-experimentation
plugins.description: TECHSPEC.md pattern for structured ML experiments. Use when: (1) Planning parameter sweeps, (2) Defining success criteria before training, (3) Budget-constrained experiment design, (4) Hypothesis-driven ablation studies. Source: Sionic AI blog.
